GPT-4o Tools API¶

Utilities under the gpt4o package support evaluating GPT-4o recommendation slates and interacting with the model provider. The modules below expose the main entry points for running evaluations, preparing conversations, and rendering leaderboard titles.

Public exports for the GPT-4o baseline package.

Command-line interface for evaluating the GPT-4o baseline model.

gpt4o.cli.build_parser()[source]¶

Create the CLI argument parser for the GPT-4o baseline.

Returns:

Fully configured argument parser for the GPT-4o CLI.

Return type:

argparse.ArgumentParser

gpt4o.cli.main(argv=None)[source]¶

Parse command-line arguments and execute the evaluation routine.

Parameters:

argv (list[str] | None) – Optional argument list to parse instead of sys.argv.

Return type:

None

Client helper for interacting with the Azure-hosted GPT-4o deployment.

gpt4o.client.ds_call(messages, max_tokens, temperature, top_p=None, deployment=None)[source]¶

Execute a chat completion call and return the trimmed text output.

Parameters:

  • messages (list[dict[str, str]]) – Chat messages formatted for the OpenAI API.

  • max_tokens (int) – Maximum number of tokens the model may generate.

  • temperature (float) – Sampling temperature forwarded to the model.

  • deployment (str | None) – Optional Azure deployment override.

  • top_p (float | None)

Returns:

Trimmed textual completion returned by the model.

Return type:

str

gpt4o.client.get_client()[source]¶

Construct or reuse the singleton Azure OpenAI client.

Returns:

Cached client configured with environment or default credentials.

Return type:

AzureOpenAIType

Configuration constants for the GPT-4o baseline and evaluation pipeline.

gpt4o.config.ensure_azure_env()[source]¶

Ensure Azure configuration defaults are present for downstream clients.

The sandbox runner historically relied on these values being set globally, so we preserve that behaviour while still allowing explicit shell overrides.

Returns:

None. The module-level constants are used when variables are unset.

Return type:

None

Prompt construction utilities for GPT-4o slate evaluations.

gpt4o.conversation.build_profile_block(example)[source]¶

Return the structured key/value profile block.

Parameters:

example (dict) – Dataset row containing viewer metadata.

Returns:

Multi-line string enumerating profile facts.

Return type:

str

gpt4o.conversation.extract_income(example)[source]¶

Mirror the income extraction logic used in the GRPO baseline.

Parameters:

example (dict) – Dataset row containing demographic metadata.

Returns:

Income phrase or normalised descriptor, else None.

Return type:

str | None

gpt4o.conversation.extract_marital_status(example)[source]¶

Extract a brief marital descriptor.

Parameters:

example (dict) – Dataset row containing marital-status related fields.

Returns:

Normalised marital descriptor or None if unknown.

Return type:

str | None

gpt4o.conversation.extract_party(example)[source]¶

Return a party label derived from standard survey signals.

Parameters:

example (dict) – Dataset row containing partisan survey responses.

Returns:

Normalised party label or None when absent.

Return type:

str | None

gpt4o.conversation.extract_race(example)[source]¶

Extract race information following the GRPO baseline rules.

Parameters:

example (dict) – Dataset row containing race attributes or textual fields.

Returns:

Canonical race label or None when no signal is found.

Return type:

str | None

gpt4o.conversation.format_ideology(raw)[source]¶

Convert ideology encodings to descriptive text.

Parameters:

raw (Any) – Raw ideology indicator (numeric or textual) from the dataset.

Returns:

Canonical ideology phrase or None when unavailable.

Return type:

str | None

gpt4o.conversation.humanise_profile(example)[source]¶

Build a human-readable viewer profile sentence.

Parameters:

example (dict) – Dataset row containing demographic and behavioural signals.

Returns:

Comma-delimited sentence summarising the viewer.

Return type:

str

gpt4o.conversation.make_conversation_record(example)[source]¶

Transform a dataset row into the prompt payload consumed by GPT-4o.

Parameters:

example (dict) – Dataset row containing slate options and viewer metadata.

Returns:

Dictionary with prompt messages and evaluation metadata.

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

gpt4o.conversation.pick_case_insensitive(record, *candidates)[source]¶

Return the first matching candidate value from record.

Parameters:

  • record (dict) – Mapping inspected for possible keys.

  • candidates (str) – Ordered list of candidate keys to search (case-insensitive).

Returns:

Stripped value associated with the first matching key, or None.

Return type:

str | None

Evaluation routines for the GPT-4o slate-ranking baseline.

Fetches the configured dataset, issues batched GPT-4o requests, parses the responses, and aggregates accuracy and formatting metrics for reporting.

GPT-4o helpers for resolving video titles used in evaluations.

  • deployment (str | None)

temperature: float¶
top_p: float | None = None¶
class gpt4o.utils.RetryPolicy(attempts=5, delay=1.0, validator=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Retry behaviour applied to GPT-4o calls.

Parameters:

  • attempts (int)

  • delay (float)

  • validator (Callable[[str], bool] | None)

attempts: int = 5¶
delay: float = 1.0¶
validator: Callable[[str], bool] | None = None¶
gpt4o.utils.call_gpt4o_with_retries(messages, *, invocation, retry=None, logger=None)[source]¶

Invoke GPT-4o with retry semantics, propagating the first successful response.

Parameters:

  • messages – Chat messages formatted for the Azure OpenAI API.

  • invocation (gpt4o.utils.InvocationParams) – Model invocation parameters (temperature, max tokens, etc.).

  • retry (gpt4o.utils.RetryPolicy | None) – Retry policy controlling attempts and delay.

  • logger (logging.Logger | None) – Optional logger for warnings.

Returns:

Model response text when successful.

Raises:

RuntimeError – After exhausting retries without a non-empty response.

gpt4o.utils.canon_text(value)[source]¶

Normalise value using the shared canonical text helper.

Parameters:

value (str | None) – Raw text value to canonicalise.

Returns:

Canonicalised string (possibly empty).

Return type:

str

gpt4o.utils.canon_video_id(value)[source]¶

Extract a canonical YouTube id from value.

Parameters:

value (str | None) – Raw identifier or text containing a video id.

Returns:

Canonical 11-character video id or empty string.

Return type:

str

Return True when the provided value should be treated as missing.

Parameters:

value (object | None) – Candidate value to inspect.

Returns:

True if the value represents a missing entry.

Return type:

bool

  • filename (str) – QA log filename to materialise.

Destination path for the QA log file.

gpt4o.utils.split_env_list(raw)[source]¶

Split raw using the separators understood by the common helper.

Parameters:

raw (str | None) – Environment variable value listing multiple items.

Returns:

List of trimmed tokens.

Return type:

list[str]

Parameters:

value (object | None) – Raw value to interpret as a boolean.

Returns:

Boolean interpretation of value.

Return type:

bool

Sequence of argument tokens suitable for gpt4o.cli.
